messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On October 10, DET. M. N. Smith was made aware of a robbery at Maplewood Mall. Main informants included Mr. Green, a shop owner, and Dr. White, the mall's vet clinic operator. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE UNIT. INFORMANT PAPERS. Lt. O. P. Johnson - OPERATIONS. Detective Smith Jr. .. HANDLING. Detective R. S. Lee and Detective T. U. Vega responded to the scene's call. MALL 14:25 Theft. Dr. White mentioned hearing a loud noise prior to the incident, while Mr. Green gave the security footage from his shop. Store. Technician Amy extracted fingerprints from the scene. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE UNIT 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Smith Jr, Det. Lee, Det. Vega OPERATIONS Lt. Johnson NOTES Ms. Green, Sarah 23 Cedar Road, Maplewood, Texas 456-789. 01234. MALL 14:25 Theft. By 2:45 PM, Detectives Smith, Lee, and Vega, collaborating with Lieutenant Johnson, pinpointed a suspicious individual in the footage. Captain V. W. Garcia raised an alarm for surrounding precincts. Sergeant X. Y. Brown and Sergeant Z. A. Cooper took the lead in interviews. Come 4:00 PM, a potential suspect was apprehended. SEND TO: DETECTIVE UNIT 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Smith Jr, Det. Lee, Det. Vega OPERATIONS Lt. Johnson REPORT SUMMARY - Theft Report 1) Security Recordings 2) Eyewitness Accounts 3) Initial Report 4) Print Analysis 5) Store Access Records (6) Supplementary Notes IDENTIFICATION Asst. CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE L. Williams P.P.D. 14.45 P78 2345 Green, SAMUEL NAME: ADDRESS: PHONE: 200-3456 DETECTIVE: M. N. Smith PRODUCT: 45-6789- 23 THEFT: 14:25 ID CODE 56789 - VERIFIED John Smith DATE 4/10/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE UNIT CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. M. N. Smith  Officer Context: On October 10, DET. M. N. Smith was made aware of a robbery at Maplewood Mall. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. O. P. Johnson  Officer Context: Lt. O. P. Johnson - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective R. S. Lee  Officer Context: Detective R. S. Lee and Detective T. U. Vega responded to the scene's call. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective T. U. Vega  Officer Context: Detective R. S. Lee and Detective T. U. Vega responded to the scene's call. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Amy  Officer Context: Store. Technician Amy extracted fingerprints from the scene. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Smith  Officer Context: By 2:45 PM, Detectives Smith, Lee, and Vega, collaborating with Lieutenant Johnson, pinpointed a suspicious individual. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain V. W. Garcia  Officer Context: Captain V. W. Garcia raised an alarm for surrounding precincts. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant X. Y. Brown  Officer Context: Sergeant X. Y. Brown and Sergeant Z. A. Cooper took the lead in interviews. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant Z. A. Cooper  Officer Context: Sergeant X. Y. Brown and Sergeant Z. A. Cooper took the lead in interviews. Officer Role: Sergeant
